title: Jurgen Klopp tells young Man Utd fan 'I can't make Liverpool lose'
description: Donegal schoolboy Daragh Curley asked the Liverpool manager if his side could lose some matches.

title: Grace Millane case: 'I went on a date with her killer after her murder'
description: "It was a very strange insight into what someone's brain does after they do something like that."

title: What are the rules on workplace surveillance?
description: Barclays is one of many companies to have used technology to monitor the activity of its staff.

title: Middlesbrough police officers help deliver baby on lunch break
description: The police officers were on their way back to base when they were flagged down.

title: Men tell of rescuing woman from submerged car roof
description: Two men waded into floodwater to rescue a woman trapped on the roof of her submerged car for 12 hours.

title: Hanau shooting: Has Germany done enough to tackle far-right terror threat?
description: The Hanau crime fuels fears that Germany has underestimated the far-right terror threat.

title: Caroline Flack death: Hairdressers bin gossip magazines
description: One salon owner said she did not want to see pages of fat-shaming and celebrities without make-up.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'uphill'
description: Each week, we publish a gallery of readers' pictures on a set theme. This week it is "uphill"

title: Priti Patel 'tried to move top civil servant'
description: The home secretary and her official disagreed but she did not bully him, a source tells the BBC.

title: Weather: Parts of UK could see a month's rain in 24 hours amid floods
description: Downpours continue as some areas struggle to cope with flooding in the wake of Storm Dennis.

title: Germany shooting: 'Far-right extremist' carried out shisha bars attacks
description: Nine people were shot dead in two shisha bars in Hanau in a case being investigated as terrorism.

title: Wales recall Davies and Moriarty to face France
description: Wales recall scrum-half Gareth Davies and flanker Ross Moriarty to face France in the Six Nations as coach Wayne Pivac makes two changes.

title: Tony Blair: Labour hopefuls must offer radical change
description: The ex-PM says the party faces a "make-or-break" moment after losing four elections in a row.

title: Two dead as Sydney to Melbourne passenger train derails
description: Others are injured as a train crashes near the Australian town of Wallan, in Victoria.

title: Double murder probe after men stabbed at Dudley cannabis farm
description: The men were injured in a street fight after a group had tried to break into a house, police say.

title: Rikki Neave: Man appears in court charged with murder
description: James Watson is accused of killing six-year-old Rikki Neave who was found strangled in woodland.

title: Federer out of French Open after knee surgery
description: Roger Federer, the 20-time Grand Slam champion, will miss this year's French Open after having surgery on his right knee.

title: Samsung explains mystery alert sent overnight
description: The company says it sent the strange "1" alert to Samsung devices by mistake.

title: Coronavirus: Britons on Diamond Princess cruise ship to be flown home
description: Only those who are well can travel, and they will be quarantined on their return, it is understood.

title: Man, 77, speaks out about fighting off would-be mugger
description: Trevor Weston was at a cash machine and says the man threatened to stab him.

title: Dame Julie Walters reveals shock of bowel cancer diagnosis
description: The actress tells Victoria Derbyshire her next film, The Secret Garden, could possibly be her last.

title: 'Birdgirl' Mya-Rose Craig to get Bristol University honorary doctorate
description: Mya-Rose Craig has been campaigning for equality in the environmental movement since 2015.

title: Aiming high but with realism setting in - where next for Wolves after rapid rise?
description: As Wolves prepare for their Europa League last-32 tie, BBC Sport's Simon Stone looks at how a club that languished in League One six years ago are now hoping to continue their rise.

title: Roma set to talk to other clubs about missing children campaign
description: Roma are set to have talks with other European clubs about raising awareness of missing children after a groundbreaking social media campaign.

title: Newspaper headlines: Immigration plan 'backlash' and flooding crisis
description: Thursday's front pages carry a wide mix of stories, including reaction to the government's immigration plan.

title: Grace Millane murder: Killer's sentencing 'is not closure'
description: "Grace is gone", her cousin says in a BBC interview, and no jail term will change the fact.

title: ‘I was labelled a bad kid when mum went to prison’
description: Toni was 11 when her mum first when to prison, she's now 21 and speaks about her experiences.

title: 'Until I met my debt mentor, I couldn't always feed my kids'
description: Audie was in debt and losing hope. But Jeannette, who'd once been in debt herself, was able to help.

title: Australia weather: 'We’ve gone from hell to high water'
description: Australians recount the drought, dust, fire and floods of one of the most turbulent summers in memory.

title: How a stolen safe changed a burglar's life
description: When Matthew Hahn saw what was inside a safe he had stolen, he knew he had to do something

title: In pictures: The battle of the oranges
description: Once a year the citizens of the old medieval town of Ivrea gather in the main square to hurl oranges.

title: Sinophobia: How a virus reveals the many ways China is feared
description: A wave of discrimination that's emerged with the coronavirus crisis shows how differently the world views China.

title: Sinn Fein surge puts Irish economy in the spotlight
description: As the Irish parliament convenes to try to choose its new leader, concerns about inequality linger.

title: My Money: 'My husband and I have 90 minutes alone together each week'
description: As part of a new BBC blog series, Maura Hannon from Switzerland shares what she spent her money on this week.

title: Coronavirus: Walking through Beijing's near-empty streets
description: The city is unrecognisable as people work from home and avoid going out.

title: Seeing double: The Indian town filled with twins
description: One town in the south Indian state of Tamil Nadu is home to hundreds of twins and no-one knows why.

title: 'Sinister, with a typical twist' - How Sochi 2014 'changed four lives forever'
description: A celebration five years late. A doping saga still serving up plot twists. Meet the four bobsleighers whose lives changed forever after Sochi 2014.

title: No-fault evictions: 'Our lives are falling apart'
description: Becky Palmer and her family were given two months to leave a home they had rented for 12 years.
